Job Title: Financial Accountant

Location: Greater St. Louis

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Analyst, Finance

Description:
Financial Accountant - St. Louis, MO (Hybrid)
Our client is a prominent investment firm based in St. Louis, Missouri. With a focus on delivering outstanding financial services and investment solutions to clients, they are renowned for their commitment to excellence, integrity, and innovation.
The Financial Accountant will play a crucial role in maintaining accurate financial records, preparing financial statements, and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. This position offers the opportunity to work in a hybrid environment, combining remote work with in-office collaboration. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 4 years of relevant experience, preferably with a background in public accounting (Big Four experience is a plus) and possess a CPA certification.
Key Responsibilities:Financial Reporting and Analysis:Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in accordance with GAAP standards.Conduct variance analysis to identify trends, discrepancies, and areas for improvement.Assist in the preparation of management reports and presentations for senior leadership.
General Ledger Management:Maintain the integrity of the general ledger and reconcile balance sheet accounts on a regular basis.Post journal entries and accruals, ensuring accuracy and completeness of accounting records.Review and analyze financial transactions to ensure compliance with internal controls and policies.
Audit and Compliance:Support external audit engagements by providing documentation, explanations, and assistance as needed.Participate in internal audit activities to assess compliance with regulatory requirements and company policies.Stay informed about changes in accounting standards and regulations affecting the investment industry.
Budgeting and Forecasting:Assist in the annual budgeting process by compiling data, preparing schedules, and analyzing budget variances.Collaborate with department heads to develop accurate budget projections aligned with strategic objectives.Provide support for ongoing forecasting efforts and financial planning initiatives.
Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.CPA certification required; Big Four experience preferred.Minimum of 3 years of experience in accounting or finance roles, preferably within the investment industry.Strong understanding of GAAP standards and financial reporting requirements.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and financial software applications (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP).Excellent analytical skills with a keen attention to detail and accuracy.Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
